prop1.title: Should OHA purchase the 50-acre farm in Mazowe?
prop1.description: We have identified a 50-acre privately owned farm in Mazowe, approximately 45 minutes from Harare. The property has clean title deeds, good road access, and potential for subdivision. The asking price is $2.5M USD, which works out to approximately $50,000 per acre. This would provide enough land for 25-30 residential plots of 1,000-2,000 sqm each, plus commercial and agricultural zones.

prop2.title: Should membership fees increase to $150 annually?
prop2.description: Due to increased legal and administrative costs, the Finance Committee proposes increasing annual membership fees from $100 to $150. This increase would help cover: legal registration costs, professional services, land due diligence, and ongoing administrative expenses. The increase would take effect from January 2026.

prop3.title: Should we prioritize commercial plots in the first development phase?
prop3.description: The Technical Services Committee suggests prioritizing commercial plot development in Phase 1 to generate early revenue for infrastructure development. This would involve developing 5-8 commercial plots first, then using rental income to fund residential infrastructure. Alternative: develop residential plots first to secure member commitments.
